application

Class SortingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.SortingManager

  • public class SortingManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Sorting manager. Takes in command line arguments and then follows the steps of parsing the args, reading the file and filling the array, calling the sorting algorithm, then printing the sorted array and the timing.
    Author:
    Hussein

    • Constructor Detail

      • SortingManager

        public SortingManager(java.lang.String[] args)
        Constructor. Reads in args then calls the parseargs, fillarray, callsort methods in order.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments

    • Method Detail

      • parseArgs

        public void parseArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parses the arguments and stores them in global variables to be used in other methods. Displays invalid messages if the arguments are written incorrectly.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments

      • fillArray

        public void fillArray()
        First creates a scanner object from the filelocation parsed from the command line arguments. It will read in the first value and use it to create an array of that size. The file is written in a pattern of Shape type, height, side/radius. It will use a loop to use reflection to create the correct object with the parameters. It will then fill the array with the Shape object.

      • callSort

        private void callSort(java.lang.String sortingAlgorithm,
                      java.lang.String comparisonType)
        Calls the sorting algorithm, then it calls printSort method to print every 1000th element of the sorted array and finally prints the amount of time it took to sort the array. Uses a switch case to determine the type of sorting algorithm to call.
        Parameters:
        sortingAlgorithm - Sorting algorithm parsed from command line arguments
        comparisonType - Comparison type parsed from command line arguments

      • printSortedArray

        private void printSortedArray()
        Prints every 1000th element of the sorted array and the last value
